text: Ahh, the Sunsoft bass; surely a beautiful thing indeed. Sunsoft taught me that the DPCM channel could be used for more than drum sounds, it taught me that it could be used for a deeper sound that blow me away as I listened in pure awe! Gimmick!, one of (and a 99.7% chance of it INDEED being) the best soundtracks the NES had to offer, Batman, with it's gameplay and music, Blaster Master, with it's gameplay and music! Sunsoft, those glory days will be missed. *sniff*
author: kapitank

text: Wow! I never played this game, and now I want to because of the music.
author: tm2jetfire

text: I don't get it. In the first game, the Joker died, it even tells us that. But here comes the Joker, AGAIN! I wish I was a videogame character. If I made a mistake and died, no worries, I'd come back in the sequel.

text: It's Sunsoft, notorious for their constant mind blowing NES music in various games.
author: ninshaw

text:
I enjoyed this game lots. It gets too much hate I think. "omg contra want to be" "omg batman with guns lame" etc etc.  

I just take it for what it is. A game with solid gameplay, and great tracks. A good difficulty level and just fun all around. if it wasnt batman and you were some other random character. I think this game would be alot more accepted, like journey to silius or something
author: Alex Anderson

text: I remember this game. Damn was it hard, but damn was it good.

text: I dont really like the begging but it gets a little better. Not one of my favorites though... anyways KEEP UP THE SONGS!

text: Sounds pretty sad. I guess Batman did his job, but he has to return to the shadows.
author: Sephiko

text: This is the ending theme? Everything mp3 listing I go to, it says this song is unused in the final version...
author: Unanimously Anonymous

text: One of the best looking games on the NES. And it wasn't just great graphics,I had a lot of fun with this platformer. I still remember beating the game for the first time and hearing this song, I had my pyjamas and it was during Christmas time, with decorations around my house and the warmth of the fireplace. Good times!
author: SupraDarky
